clean_content:
Definition / general

* Distinctive subgroup of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors that are well differentiated with a low mitotic rate and low Ki67 proliferative index as well as have a cystic component ([Am J Surg Pathol 2012;36:1666](23073325))

Essential features

* Histologically resembles typical pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor but with cystic component* Improved prognosis* Occurs more frequently in patients with MEN1

ICD coding

* ICD-10: [C25.4](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/C15-C26/C25-/C25.4) - malignant neoplasm of endocrine pancreas

Epidemiology

* Up to 17% of pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are purely or partially cystic, due to cystic degeneration of originally solid tumor ([J Am Coll Surg 2008;206:1154](18501813), [Rev Esp Enferm Dig 2018;110:130](29313698))

Sites

* More common in tail of pancreas

Pathophysiology

* 10 - 25% are associated with MEN1, occur in younger patients and are more often multiple and functional ([Rev Esp Enferm Dig 2017;109:778](29072081))

Clinical features

* Usually (85%) nonfunctional ([Rev Esp Enferm Dig 2017;109:778](29072081))* If functional, usually insulinoma* Often (45%) diagnosed incidentally ([Rev Esp Enferm Dig 2017;109:778](29072081))

Diagnosis

* Can be confirmed by octreoscan scintigraphy

Radiology description

* Cystic, making diagnosis difficult; may be confused with other pancreatic cystic lesions (including intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasm and mucinous cystic neoplasm)* Usually shows peripheral enhancement ([AJR Am J Roentgenol 2013;200:W283](23436873))

Radiology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrineradio1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4127522/figure/F1/)

Cystic pancreas lesion on CT scan

Prognostic factors

* Better prognosis than noncystic neuroendocrine tumors of pancreas* 60% disease free survival at 10 years ([Rev Esp Enferm Dig 2017;109:778](29072081))

Case reports

* 20 year old woman with incidental tumor ([J Cancer Res Ther 2012;8:289](22842378))* 42 year old woman with cystic mass and tumorlets ([World J Gastroenterol 2017;23:6911](29085235))* 51 year old woman with multicystic pancreas mass ([Clin J Gastroenterol 2018;11:87](29270782))* 66 year old woman with lesion mimicking mucinous cystic neoplasm ([Clin J Gastroenterol 2018;11:333](29536430))* 78 year old man with epigastric pain ([BMC Res Notes 2014;7:510](25106541))

Treatment

* Surgical excision

Gross description

* Mean 5 cm* Generally unilocular cystic lesion filled with straw colored fluid

Gross images

Contributed by Wei Chen, M.D., Ph.D., Nakul Anush Ravish, M.B.B.S. and AFIP images  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrinegrossAFIP1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrinegrossAFIP1.jpg)

Large cystic tumor

[![Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticfluidanalysisChenRavish06.jpeg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticfluidanalysisChenRavish06.jpeg)

Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrinegross1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5645625/figure/F5/)

Cystic pancreas mass

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrinejama01.png)](https://archsurg.jamanetwork.com/data/journals/surg/9743/m_sif70020f1.png)

Large spherical lesion with multiple loculations arising from head of pancreas

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrinecdn01.jpg)](https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S1072751508000240-gr2.jpg)

Cystic pancreatic endocrine neoplasm

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Typically appears as a thick fibrous wall with neuroendocrine cells lining the central cystic space and sometimes forming nests or vesicular structures within the fibrosis ([Am J Surg Pathol 2001;25:752](11395552))* Necrosis and lymphovascular invasion are uncommon

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Raul S. Gonzalez, M.D.  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez01new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez01new.jpg)

Fibrous wall

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez02new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez02new.jpg)

Cyst lining

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez03new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez03new.jpg)

Unilocular lesion

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez04new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreascysticendocrineGonzalez04new.jpg)

Neuroendocrine cells within fibrosis

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrinemicro1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5645625/figure/F6/)

Cystic pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor

Cytology description

* Loosely cohesive aggregates and single cells* Cells are small and plasmacytoid with occasional cytoplasmic vacuoles; nuclei are round / oval and uniform with finely and evenly distributed chromatin ([Cancer 2009;117:203](19365841))

Cytology images

Images hosted on other servers:  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrinecyto1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4127522/figure/F4/)

Plasmacytoid cells on FNA

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreascysticendocrineacs01.jpg)](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/cncy.20024/full#fig2)

Conventional smear

Positive stains (IHC and special stains)

* Neuroendocrine markers ([synaptophysin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainssynaptophysin.html)
  / [chromogranin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainschromogranin.html))* Often express [glucagon](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/glucagon.html) but do not behave clinically as [glucagonomas](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasglucagonoma.html)

Sample pathology report

* Pancreas, tail, resection:
  + Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor with cystic degeneration, WHO grade 1 (see synoptic report and comment)+ Comment: Immunohistochemical stains for synaptophysin and chromogranin are positive and the Ki67 index is approximately 1.1%.

Differential diagnosis

* [Acinar cell cystadenoma / cystadenocarcinoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/pancreasacinarcellcystadenoma.html):
  + Cysts are lined by acinar cells without associated acinar cell nests+ Negative for [synaptophysin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainssynaptophysin.html)
      and [chromogranin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainschromogranin.html)
